comments.author: @mazda_miata_
comments.text: I'm sort of 50/50 with the idea of reaction channels. I like that, like you said, they basically give a sort of shoutout to smaller youtubers. They can easily double your amount of subscribers, likes, and views in general. But I don't like that they barely work for the many subs they get. They just take a video, react to it, upload it, bitches go cray and they get a million views. It's really unoriginal and boring, to just see the same person reacting to similar videos. And it's even worse to see the person trying too hard, like something isn't that funny but they're laughing really hard, just to have a reaction instead of having none. That's just my opinion, though.

comments.author: @spysoldier8583
comments.text: This statement of yours¬†saying reaction channels are¬†benefiting channels they're reacting to, is false. First of all,¬†just because they re-upload¬†people's videos and encourage¬†the viewers to go check them out by leaving their links in the description or¬†on the screen, doesn't mean the viewer would go out¬†of their way to watch a video they've just watched, especially if that video is unpopular and is from an unpopular channel.¬†The majority of viewers who don't give a damn about the channel the reactor is shouting out to¬†is a higher amount than the majority of viewers who actually give the channel a chance,¬†because in terms of common sense, who would re-watch a video they've just watched and their encouragement to¬†re-watch the video and subscribe to the¬†channel are links? Them¬†saying it's¬†benefiting¬†channels they've just reacted to is a way to deceive people into thinking they're doing good in the community, when actually they're breaking the youtube¬†community guidelines, making money out of other people's content,¬†and violating fair use, which means even if the viewers do benefit you, at the end of the day, the only people getting credit will¬†be them. They'll get¬†the likes, views, subs, and money that your channel should be getting for your own content, and they use that¬†free promotion lie to cover themselves, when really, they don't give a damn about you, they're in it for that money.
